snippet: Pfizer said in a regulatory filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission that it was taking a $450 million charge against first-quarter earnings to settle the case.
abstract: Pfizer settles lawsuit filed by Brigham Young University for $450 million over development of the painkiller Celebrex; company will take a $450 million charge against first-quarter earnings for the settlement.
lead_paragraph: Pfizer said in a regulatory filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission that it was taking a $450 million charge against first-quarter earnings to settle the case.

headline.main: Pfizer Settles B.Y.U. Lawsuit Over Development of Celebrex
headline.print_headline: Pfizer Settles College’s Lawsuit Over Development of Celebrex
